summary: A grand jury subpoena issued by the Southern District of New York on August 27, 2020, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear on September 24, 2020, to testify and produce documents regarding alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to maintain confidentiality.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce evidence.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the Acting U.S. Attorney.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), 371 (conspiracy), and 1623 (false declarations).
The recipient is commanded to appear on September 24, 2020, at 10:00 a.m. and to produce items listed in an attached rider.
The U.S. Attorney's office requests the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document includes standard advice of rights, including the right to refuse to answer self-incriminating questions and the right to consult with an attorney.
